titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Oct. 26 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Oct. 26
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Tuesday October 26, 1824 session of court, during which a plea of default was heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Tuesday 26th
div.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors &C et cetera Jurors George Saunders, Foreman

Fishing Hawk
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
William Burges
Dft Defendant

On a plea of default Appeal from
Amoiah Amoah District to the Supreme Court
It is the opinion of the Court, that William Burges shall pay the Fishing Hawk, forty dollars for his horse
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
